title: For Sale:  m28 Mosin Nagant finnish variant
postcontent:
The m/28 is one of the scarcest Finnish rifles to found on the US collector market and one of the authors favorites in the Finnish wartime 1939-1945 rifle series. This scarcity is due in fact to the low production numbers originally produced and the attrition that resulted from use in 3 wars and countless training sessions as part of Army inventory post war. These rifles did not apparently enjoy the wide scale refurbishment programs that most of the other Finnish rifles did. The total production of m/28 being listed at 33.016 is by far the fewest of any Finnish service rifle from 1927-1945. The Finnish Defense forces list an inventory from 1951 of only 16,600 of m/28 type in storage. These rifles are the forerunner of the famed and storied m/28-30 and many shoot as well as their famous younger cousin. These rifles also have some of the rarest official variations in a series to be found in this model such as the civilian purchase/upgrade model and the transitional models produced by the factory from remaining m/28 stockpile parts. The Finnish Defense Force officially declared the rifle obsolete in the mid 1980’s and disposed of them to the collector market in the US. in 1986. Today they are a highly sought after collectors piece both here in the States and world wide.   This rifle has no importation stamps!!!    It was more than likely great grandpa's bring back rifle from World War 2 but was made/originally issued circa 1931 as a Civil Guard weapon made in the sako factory   .  as seen in the pictures it does have 3 kill notches carved into the stock.. numbers match bolt and receiver. the bad it is missing the rear swivel ski style sling mount... and the good has an immaculate sharp bore with a Type 2 SIG barrel ....  the only reason why I'm selling or willing to trade for a 91 -30 Pu is because I want to put one in an archangel stock... needless to say this rifle does not deserve that treatment... it holds way too much history. 

 call or text. 502-403- six six 79

postcontent:
For sale/trade is my used Aimpoint CompM4 which retails for $850. I'm asking $400 for it, due to it being in used condition. Everything on it works 100%, just minor scratches to the finish, no damage to the lenses. The ARD (kill-flash) and bikini-style rubber lens cover are included with the sale. This is NOT a replica/clone, it is an authentic Aimpoint, which can be verified by contacting Aimpoint.

Some features of the Comp M4:
Internal voltage regulator allows the CompM4 to be used with any AA size battery
7 night vision compatible settings and 9 daylight settings
QRP2 mount has twice the clamping force of the original QRP, and the mounting knob is wider and shorter to improve operation, and lessen the chance of becoming snagged on other gear
Mount base is "keyed" into to the body of the sight to absorb recoil
Mount base screws directly into the sight - no separate sight ring is required
2 MOA dot for close combat and long distance engagement
Matches perfectly with Aimpoint 3XMag, (magnifier module)
Unequalled light transmission
Submersible to 150 feet (45 meters)
Vertical spacer included
Standardized as the US Army's new M68CCO
Improved adjustment caps are easier to remove, and are protected against impact
Dimensions (in inches): 5.3 (l) x 3 (w) x 2.8 (h)
Weight: 9.3 oz sight only, 11.8 oz with integrated mount
Up to 8 years (80,000 hours) of battery life with continuous use at position 12 of 16
Up to 500,000 hours of battery life with continuous night vision use


Email me if you are interested, price is non negotiable. Will only trade for Gen 4 Glock 26.

Willing to ship anywhere in the continental USA for an extra $20, shipping will be USPS priority 3-day and will be insured for $500.

title: For Trade:  Springfield Armory 1911 Loaded
postcontent:
2013 safe-queen Springfield Armory Loaded 1911. Kept in climate controlled safe and hasn't seen hardly any use. 

Cash or Trade but I heavily prefer a trade for this gun. Basically rifles only, definitely no handguns unless you have an FNP .45 tactical in decent condition. I'm looking for a .308 but the right 5.56/.223 might do. 

You can make a cash offer but it's not too likely that I'll go for less than MSRP, (which in this case would be around the $1,400 range) I love this gun. My ideal trade would be an M1A, maybe a nice HK91, etc. I'll consider high-quality milled 7.62 rifles on a case-by-case basis, and definitely send pictures for those offers please. 

Details:::
Gun's finish is what Springfield calls "Black Armory Kote" in matte black, it is durable. I'll be very frank and detailed with the description of this gun, honestly you have to look very closely to find any imperfections on it anywhere. It has a stainless barrel that has slight smear-like wear over the chamber of the barrel at the 1/2" of the front end of the chamber top where it meets the ejection port front end, no scratching. I've put 300-500 rounds through the gun, it's in collection condition and has always been kept in a climate-controlled safe. I take down the gun after every use and treat it properly. 

Cocobolo wood grips from South America with 18LPI checkering. Adjustable tritium Trijicon sights front and back. Slight holster wear on the same half-inch or so where the barrel smudging is contacting the slide, and at the front inch of the slide on the corners. Comes with ammo, maybe 300-700 rounds? and 3 mags. Let me know if you're interested, if you are I'll take closer pictures for you.  

Here are the Trijicon sights on the 1911:::     
http://www.midwayusa.com/product/195977/trijicon-night-sight-set-kimber-1911-steel-matte-3-dot-tritium-green?cm_vc=ProductFinding 

Other features:
-front and rear cocking serrations

A single button does the math. Just squeeze the trigger and remember your knife. Amazingly compact and simple to use, the Scout 1000 ARC figures distance based on terrain angle to give you an accurate “shoots-like” distance to 1,000 yards. Rifle Mode even tells you where to hold. With selectable Bow and Rifle Modes, it has the same capability some competitors need to split into two separate units. All with the tap of a button – in a vertical unit small enough to fit in your shirt pocket. In capability and ease of use, no one comes close to Bushnell.

Unmatched ballistic capability. Extreme up-and-downhill angles after true horizontal distance to your target. ARC accounts for the terrain when calculating distance, so you know precisely how to shoot the range.

title: For Sale:  Charter Arms .357 Magnum Pug Stainless Snub 2 1/2 inch Ported 5 Shot Lightweight NIB 357 Mag .38 Special Interchangeably Matte Finish Combat Rubber Grips 73520 No MA CA DC
postcontent: Our # HG73520Charter Arms opened shop in 1964, and we began selling their products by 1966. The Charter Undercover looked and felt enough like a Smith & Wesson Airweight to suit us, and since those were the days of Super Vel Ammunition, we liked the Charter Steel frame. By 1984, when the 2 inch .357 Tracker debuted, we no longer needed Super Vel, you know, shoot it with .38 wadcutters and carry it with Federal 125 grain magnums. Here is Charter’s Magnum Pug in Lightweight Stainless. Manufacturer is Charter Arms of Shelton, CT. Factory variant number is 73520. Type is traditional double and single action true swingout revolver. Chambering is .357 Remington Magnum and .38 Smith & Wesson calibers interchangeably. Construction is all steel, with the exception of the alloy trigger guard and grip frame, with factory rubber combat finger groove grips. Barrel is one piece, with six groove right hand 18 3/4 rifling fore in a full lug shroud. Front Sight is serrated ramp type rib integral. Main frame is stainless steel, with an alloy grip frame. Cylinder is stainless 5 shot, and the Charter accepts ammunition from a 36A size speedloader. Trigger is .300 serrated face, with matching serrated spur hammer. Charters generally pull double action in the 10 – 11 pound vicinity, and 4 pound area single action, with minimal felt creep. Ignition is floating firing pin, with transfer bar safety mechanism that prevents the hammer from contacting the pin unless the trigger is fully depressed. Weight empty is 23 ounces, a shade less than a Smith & Wesson 640. The Mag Pug stays more point of aim with heavier bullets, 158 grain .38s or .357s. This revolver is not a fun gun to shoot with full house magnum loads. Each Magnum Pug comes in its factory hard shell case with protective papers, instruction manual, factory registration card, and gun lock. Similar revolvers from Taurus, Smith & Wesson, and Ruger command prices upwards of $800 apiece. We’re offering the Charter Magnum Pug Lightweight .357 Stainless in the photos, however, or one of its identical mates for only $ 359.00. Not transferable to civilian residents of California, District of Colombia, or Massachusetts. 2% discount if payment is with USPS Money Order & Not Credit Card. Any ammunition or personnel in our photos is Not included.  Shipping. $15 lower 48; $40 Alaska, Hawaii or Puerto Rico, USPS Priority, insured with Delivery Confirmation. Don’t let your buddies use your account, that kind of thing smells like felony level straw purchase attempt. NO AMEX NO PAYPAL. We accept MC/Visa/Discover/USPS MO paid orders shipped ASAP. 7 day hold on checks. FFL ok by fax, e-mail or mail, please ask your dealer to put your name and Gun Brand on there. 7 day money back on used, no return on New Items, layaway, or ammo. We do not pay transfer fees or return shipping. Lay-away 20% down, balance in 90 days. Phone hours 8:00 – 5:00 CST Mon - Fri CST. Local pickup OK. Finish Quality and 100% for Function.

This Revolver is completely original, right down to the Serial Numbered Wood Stocks (Grips). It is NOT a "Safe Queen" and will make an excellent

title: For Sale/Trade:  My Two for your One
postcontent:
I have a great Sig Sauer combo for sale or possible trade. What we have here is a Sig Sauer 556 Swat Patrol rifle chambered in 5.56x45/.223. This rifle is a piston driven merge between the AR15 and AK47. It takes any AR-15 magazines, but thanks to the piston system it does not suffer from all the dirt and grim blowing back into the chamber that an AR does. The rifle also has an adjustable gas system for rough environments or when the rifle is extremely dirty and you need it to function. The rifle itself is stock with the factory diopter sights. I've added a 2 point sling and magpul Vertical Fore Grip that will come with the rifle, along with one 30 round GI mag and the original box/docs/lock from the factory. The rifle hasn't been fired, I just found another rifle I'd rather have so I'm selling this package to afford it.

The pistol included is a Sig SP2022 chambered in 9mm. It comes with a range kit that includes 3 15 round magazines, a swappable back strap, chamber lock, Sig holster, and the original factory box and documents. The pistol has had 45 flawless rounds fired through it, and is the same quality DA/SA with a de-cocker that you would expect from a Sig hammer fired pistol. 

I am open to parting these two firearms out, but would prefer to sell them as a pair, so I have put them at a good price. I can be reached best by PM or text at REDACTED.

title: For Sale:  NIB CZ Custom Shop ACCU SHADOW BLK #91735
postcontent:
Better move on this one soon.  These are hard to find and this new, unfired one will definitely be gone by the end of this weekend!  If you have any serious interest, please let me know.  Otherwise, it will be sold or delisted no later than Sunday evening, or earlier.   Price is $2499.  Going once, going twice.....

Test shot pic shows date of 3/2/15.  Just built this Custom Shop gun!!

I simply have too many guns, including four other custom CZ's and decided to let this one go.  Keep in mind I follow all laws on gun transfers, and have no interest in trades.  Comes with three 18 round mags.

Below is the blurb:

CZC ACCU Shadow  (CZC Custom Version with Match Fit Barrel)
CZC MATCH BARREL & FIXED SIGHT
CZC 75 SP01 ACCU Shadow #91735
USPSA Production Approved!
Features
*CZC Fitted Match Barrel
*CZC Stainless steel barrel bushing.
*CZC Stainless steel reverse plug.
*CZC SHORT reset trigger system “CZC SRTS”
*CZC Competition Fixed rear sight.

These modifications have been added to the already customized CZ Custom SP01 Shadow Pistol. #91029

We have been very busy at the CZ Custom Shop over the last few months. We have been working and perfecting some new products and parts for the SP01 Shadow and the CZ 75 Shadow. This details the changes brought about to create the CZ 75 SP01 ACCU SHADOW.

Let’s talk about the difference:

We have hand fitted the "Made in the USA" CZC Match Grade Barrel, tighter fit and tolerance then standard factory barrel.

The new barrel bushing is threaded into the slide; the bushing is fitted to the barrel creating far less play than the current bushing system. The bushing also retains the new stainless steel guide plug.

The bushing keeps the front sight in the slide so no pin is necessary or needed (fitting the pin will damage the bushing threads.)

The bushing will need to be removed before the barrel can be taken from the gun.

Ransom Rest testing at 50 yards with Fiocchi 125 JHP (A ZERO bullet) has proved group of less than 3” compared with a factory new gun at about 5.0”. At 25 yards the groups were around 1.2” a one-hole group.

Supplied with: 
(1) Bushing Wrench
(3) 18 round 9mm magazines (I am adding the fourth)
